_header: As that a great clerk shows in his books
_description: The Lay Folk’s Catechism, by John de Gaytryge (or Gaysteke, Caterige, etc.), in alliterative unrhymed verse

BodDonC13.First Lines:
Als þat a grete clerk shewis in his bokeof alle þe
                    creatures þat god made in heuen or in erth…
BodDonC13.Last Lines:
…It is endles life and lastande blisto whilk blis he bringre
                    vs Qui cum [ ] spiritu sancto vivit & regnet deus per omnia saecula
                        saeculorum

BodRawC288.First Lines:
As a gret clerk schewyth in hys bokysof alle creatures þat
                    euer god made…
BodRawC288.Last Lines:
…to qwich blys bryng ȝow & meþat for us deyt on
                    þe roode tre amen amen
BodRawC288.Note:

‘How Preists should instructe þere Parishioners’ (f. 85 in

BLAdd24202.First Lines:
[Þ]u þinge for to knowe god almyȝtyes þe seuene
                    sacramentis þat holy chirche gifes…
BLAdd24202.Last Lines:
…mekely to suffur wheþer so euere fall is woo or
                    welþeand þat our herte be noghte ouer highe for no
                    welfare…
BLAdd24202.Note:
Sections on the Seven Sacraments and Seven Virtues only. Text is
                    incomplete, ending mid-way through the sixth vertue. Written as
                    prose.
